weather_report:
As the sun rises over Downtown San Francisco, it greets a canvas draped in hues of grey and silver, typical of a summer morning kissed by the lingering breath of the Pacific Ocean. The air hangs heavy with the prospect of a light drizzle before the day unfolds, though the chance of rain remains slight, cloaked within a 30% probability that whispers of a more temperamental sky. A West Southwest wind flirts with the trees, rustling leaves and nudging the chill of the morning into heartier garbs. The high is merely a whisper above sixty degrees, leaving one to ponder layering a light sweater over that casual t-shirt. 

As the hours drift on, expect an evening shaped by clouds, blanketing the city as dusk approaches and temperatures flirt with a cozy mid-fifties chill. The fog, typical of these wraparound coastal lands, may find a way to weave itself into the skyline, cloaking the Golden Gate Bridge at times while imparting a serene mystique to the city. It’s a day suited for striding along the Embarcadero, where the sight of the bay and the sounds of the city blend into a therapeutic concoction. Maybe a quiet visit to a local café, cradling a warm beverage as the world goes by, fits the mood. Outside, the fog rolls in gently, adding a touch of romance to the everyday moments.
